intro: Hapalochilus acanthoglossus, commonly known as the rough-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and southern Asia. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species and cotton plants. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in its native habitats.
